case_vignette: A 75-year-old man comes to the physician for the evaluation of progressive shortness of breath and fatigue over the past month. He reports that he cannot climb more than one flight of stairs without experiencing shortness of breath and dizziness. He has hypertension and hyperlipidemia. He has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for the past 50 years. He does not drink alcohol. His medications include enalapril, atorvastatin, and low-dose aspirin. His temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 70/min, respirations are 18/min, and blood pressure is 100/80 mm Hg. Physical examination shows weak peripheral pulses. Cardiac examination is shown.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been dealing with progressive shortness of breath and fatigue for the past month.
Have you noticed if the shortness of breath is worse with activity or lying flat?
Yes, it gets worse when I try to climb more than one flight of stairs, and that's when I also feel dizzy.
Do you have any chest pain or tightness associated with these symptoms?
No, I do not have any chest pain or tightness.
Have you ever been diagnosed with any heart or lung condition in the past?
No, I haven't been diagnosed with heart or lung conditions, just hypertension and hyperlipidemia.
Are you currently on any medications for your hypertension and hyperlipidemia?
Yes, I'm taking enalapril for hypertension and atorvastatin for hyperlipidemia.
Have you experienced any swelling in your legs or feet recently?
The case vignette does not provide information about swelling in my legs or feet, so I cannot confirm or deny that symptom.
Understood. Could you tell me your age and whether you have any family history of heart disease?
I am 75 years old and the vignette doesn't mention a family history of heart disease.
Final Diagnosis: Heart failure with preserved ejection fraction (HFpEF) due to age, hypertension, and hyperlipidemia.
